definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
Zaoshen, the god of the kitchen/also written 灶神
same as 閻羅王|阎罗王/Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja

sentences.english: Sometimes, he is shown standing next to a horse.
sentences.chinese: 有時，畫像中的竈王爺是站在一匹馬的旁邊。

sentences.english: They are offering sacrifice to the Kitchen God.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在給竈王爺提供貢品。

sentences.english: He was made a duke for his contribution in fighting against the Huns.
sentences.chinese: 在抗擊匈奴的戰爭中立功，他被授予王爺的位號。

sentences.english: Is afraid that I went to Lan wave building and see county Wang Ye?
sentences.chinese: 是怕我去了瀾波館見着郡王爺？

sentences.english: "In order to her, you open six sovereign even tells all don"t?
sentences.chinese: 爲了她，你堂堂六王爺連帝位都不要了？

sentences.english: Male comrades all enjoy a sense of Wangyeh to do so.
sentences.chinese: 所有的男同志們都享受了一回做王爺的感覺。

sentences.english: The skill of the disease could save lives, book in hand.
sentences.chinese: 得這種病的人能否保住性命，生殺大權在閻王爺手中。

sentences.english: The picture of the Kitchen God shows a man dressed in fine clothes.
sentences.chinese: 畫像中的竈王爺穿着漂亮的衣服。

sentences.english: Blue King, Nangong Wang, you are a girl?
sentences.chinese: 藍王爺，南宮王爺，你們看上了哪家的姑娘啊？

sentences.english: Blue King, Nangong Wang, you are a girl?
sentences.chinese: 藍王爺，南宮王爺，你們看上了哪家的姑娘啊？

sentences.english: Another one is offering sacrifice to the Kitchen God.
sentences.chinese: 另外一種是給竈王爺提供貢品。

sentences.english: People offer a sacrifice to the Kitchen God on this day.
sentences.chinese: 這一天的活動叫做“祭竈”，也就是“拜竈王爺”。

sentences.english: In order to keep a good life, the moon had to marry weng for report.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保住帕良的性命，明月只好嫁給翁因王爺。

sentences.english: Shen returned to his parents for a pride.
sentences.chinese: 沈王爺回到他的父母那裏期待能夠得到讚賞。

sentences.english: At this time, people offer sacrifice to the kitchen god.
sentences.chinese: 在這一天，人們應該向竈王爺獻祭。

sentences.english: This county Wang Ye seems to be good at to throw it like.
sentences.chinese: 哦？這位郡王爺似乎很會投其所好。

definition: to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
(respectful for) one's grandfather/sb's father/older people/the head of the house (used by servants)/a district magistrate
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
